page.title: 14CROSSFORD GALA (continued)
page.content: The main event of Gala Week is Gala Day itself, 1st June 1985. The King George V playing fields in the village are transformed for the day by the Gala committee. A marquee is erected for the distribution of lunch-bags, an arena roped off for performers and competitions, and stalls and side-shows (manned by members of village organisations) set up around the edges of the park. It all starts at 11a.m. as the parade of children, and adults, in fancy dress, begins at the eastern edge of the village and continues for half a mile along the Main Street, the parade being led by bands and by the Gala Queen and her attendants. Following the judging of fancy dress and floats, the park becomes one huge picnic site as villagers settle down to enjoy the rest of he day.
